Meal 2 - Mid-Morning Snack (10:00 AM) - 350 calories
- 120g salmon
- 30g mixed almonds
- 1/2 avocado
Macros: 35g protein, 15g carbs, 25g fat

Meal 3 - Lunch (1:00 PM) - 550 calories
- 150g lean ground turkey
- 100g quinoa
- Roasted vegetables (broccoli, zucchini)
- Olive oil dressing
Macros: 50g protein, 60g carbs, 15g fat

Meal 4 - Pre-Workout (4:00 PM) - 300 calories
- Rice protein shake
- 1 banana
- 30g almond butter
Macros: 25g protein, 35g carbs, 10g fat

Meal 5 - Post-Workout (6:00 PM) - 350 calories
- 120g lean beef
- Cauliflower rice
- Steamed green beans
Macros: 40g protein, 25g carbs, 10g fat

Meal 6 - Evening (8:30 PM) - 150 calories
- 100g egg whites
- Small mixed green salad
Macros: 20g protein, 10g carbs, 3g fat

Hydration:
- 3-4 liters water daily
- Electrolyte supplementation

Supplements (Gluten-free, Dairy-free):
- Zinc
- Magnesium
- Fish oil
- Rice/pea protein powder

Key Considerations:
- Gradual weight cut
- Monitor energy levels
- Adjust portions as needed
- Consult nutritionist/coach

Budget-Friendly Tips:
- Buy proteins in bulk
- Frozen vegetables
- Seasonal produce
- Meal prep

Notes:
- Gluten-free verified foods
- No dairy products
- High protein sources
- Balanced nutrient profile

Estimated Weekly Grocery Cost: $120-$150

Disclaimer: Individual metabolic needs vary. Personalize with professional guidance.

solution_criteria: Provide total daily calories within 2200-2500 calorie range
Ensure protein intake is 1.8-2.2g per kg of target body weight
Include meal timing appropriate for pre/post training nutrition
Accommodate specified dietary restrictions
test_case.task_description: Write a compact, concise 1 day meal plan for a single athlete
test_case.scenario: Mixed martial arts fighter preparing for weight class weigh-in with precise nutritional requirements

reasoning: The solution meets most mandatory requirements with a structured meal plan that addresses dietary restrictions. However, protein intake needs adjustment to match 1.8-2.2g per kg of target body weight (70 kg).
